_header: What is this world but only vanity
_description: A warning against the uncertainties of this world — one stanza rhyme royal

BodDou45.First Lines:
What is this worlde but oonly vanyteWho trustith fortune sounest
                    hath a falle…
BodDou45.Last Lines:
…Is to thynk on welth þat is gon and pastAnd in olde age
                    in mysery tobe cast
BodDou45.Editions:
Brown,  Carleton Fairchild,
                        ed.  
             Religious Lyrics of the XVth Century.
         Oxford: Clarendon, 1939: 260.
Oliver,  Raymond. 
             Poems Without Names: The English Lyric 1200-1500.
         Berkeley, CA: University of California, 1970: 90.

BLRoy17Dvi.Transcription: What is this worlde but oonly vaniteWho trusteth fortune sannest hath a falleEueri man beware of prodigalite…
BLRoy17Dvi.Note: These three lines only; same three lines repeated by a later hand below; added to front flyleaf.
